alert.note: Alert for Sanders (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 21 at 9:56PM MDT until May 22 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Thorne Creek Burn Area in... Southwestern Sanders County in northwestern Montana... * Until midnight MDT. * At 956 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Thorne Creek Burn Area. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Goat Creek and Thompson River Road. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Thorne Creek Burn Area. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Thorne Creek Burn Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
